Dialogue: Do you know what your problem is?

Speaker: tess
Dialogue: You've met too many people like you.  I'm with Terry now.

Speaker: high roller
Dialogue: You don't want to get in the hole too heavy to this Benedict. A friend of mine once borrowed a hundred g's from the guy. Two months went by, Benedict hadn't heard from him, he calls my friend up, asks 'Where's my money?' I'll get to it when I get to it,' my friend says. Half hour later Benedict's in my friend's hotel room, dangling him off his 10th floor balcony by his feet. 'You gonna get to it now?'

Speaker: high roller
Dialogue: Eh. They put too much grenadine in my Shirley Temple.

Speaker: benedict
Dialogue: And here I thought you were drinking vodka.  Mr. Zerga.

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: Mr. Benedict. I recognize you from the TV. You know, nine casinos out of ten, owner comes up in the middle of the hand to ask me what I want. I respect your waiting.

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: And I have to impose on your hospitality. Can you sit in for a hand?

Speaker: benedict
Dialogue: I'd love to, Mr. Zerga, but the gaming board would feed me to my white tigers.

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: That's a shame. You're the king of Vegas and you have to play craps in the alley.

Speaker: benedict
Dialogue: No shame at all. Reminds me of my youth.

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: The fight is Saturday, is it not?

Speaker: benedict
Dialogue: Yes.   I can get you seats...

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: No, no. Hand-to-hand combat doesn't interest me. I have a package arriving here Saturday evening. A black briefcase, standard size, the contents of which are very valuable to me.

Speaker: benedict
Dialogue: I'd be happy to put it in the house safe for you.

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: The house safe is for brandy and grandmother's pearls. I'm afraid I need something more secure.

Speaker: benedict
Dialogue: I can assure you, the house safe is utterly...

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: I can assure you, Mr. Benedict, your generosity in this matter will not go overlooked. Now: what can you offer me besides the safe?

Speaker: tess
Dialogue: See, the kind of people you steal things from, they have insurance to compensate them. They get made whole again. I had to leave New York to get away from what happened. How do I get my five years back, Danny?

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: You can't. But what you can do is not throw away another five years.

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: Listen, you don't love me anymore, you want to make a life with someone else? Fine, I'll have to live with that. But not him.

Speaker: tess
Dialogue: I'm not laughing.  You have to admit there's a conflict of interest when you give me advice about my love life.

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: Yes. But that doesn't mean I'm wrong.

Speaker: tess
Dialogue: Do you remember what I said to you when we first met?

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: You said: you better know what you're doing.

Speaker: tess
Dialogue: Do you? Now? Because -- truly -- you should walk out the door if you don't.

Speaker: benedict
Dialogue: Forgive me for being late. A guest required my attention.

Speaker: tess
Dialogue: Danny was just walking through the restaurant and spotted me.

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: I was shocked myself.   Imagine the odds.

Speaker: benedict
Dialogue: 'Of all the gin joints in all the world...'  You've been in prison until recently, isn't that right? How does it feel to be out?

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: About the same. Everything you want is still on the other side.

Speaker: benedict
Dialogue: There's the human condition for you.

Speaker: tess
Dialogue: Terry, Danny was just about to...

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: I just wanted to say hello.   For old time's sake.

Speaker: benedict
Dialogue: Stay for a drink, if you like.

Speaker: benedict
Dialogue: Well, then I don't imagine we'll be seeing you again, Mr. Ocean.

Speaker: benedict
Dialogue: I know everything that happens in my hotels.

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: So I should put those towels back.

Speaker: basher
Dialogue: Just jumping into the shower, can you come back later?

Speaker: reporter
Dialogue: ... and here's Reuben Tishkoff, former owner of the Paradiso, come to bid farewell to his fabled resort and wish Terry Benedict all the best with his future plans for the property...

Speaker: benedict
Dialogue: I hope there's as much dynamite in the Paradiso as there will be in this Saturday's fight.

Speaker: rusty
Dialogue: Call is at five-thirty. Makeup and costume. Saul's package arrives at seven-fifteen, and Linus grabs our codes. All goes well there and we're a go. Seven- thirty Virgil and Turk deliver Yen and we're committed. From that point, we have thirty minutes to blow the power or he suffocates.

Speaker: rusty
Dialogue: Okay: they've put you in the middle of the room, far from everything. You have to get from here to the door without touching the floor. What do you do?

Speaker: basher
Dialogue: The damn demo crew didn't use a coaxial lynch to back the mainline! Onioned the mainframe couplet!

Speaker: basher
Dialogue: Blew the backup grid one by one! Like dominoes!

Speaker: basher
Dialogue: So unless we decide to do this job in Reno, we're screwed.

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: Could a pinch take out the power of an entire city? Like, I don't...

Speaker: basher
Dialogue: Las Vegas?  But there's only one pinch in the world big enough to handle it.

Speaker: turk
Dialogue: You don't know your string theory, bitch.

Speaker: virgil
Dialogue: Mom told me she loves me more.

Speaker: turk
Dialogue: She told me she was going to tell you that.

Dialogue: TURK  Make me.  They can be heard WRESTLING. Linus has had enough.     He sneaks out the van's back door without the Malloys hearing him.

Dialogue: of the lab, and its beveled-glass stairwell. Linus scrambles up its steps, a flight ahead of a duo of chasing guards. As he ascends out of sight...  Danny shifts his focus to -

Speaker: danny's pov
Dialogue: The other side of the building, and two more guards arriving on the roof and moving toward the staircase: Linus will be trapped.

Speaker: basher
Dialogue: Then there'll be two of us who need saving.

Speaker: turk
Dialogue: Would you -- shouldn't someone be behind the wheel?

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: Alright, back it up, back it up!

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: I say stay in the van, you stay in the van, got it? 'Cause you lose focus for one second in this game, and someone gets hurt.

Speaker: jim lampley
Dialogue: ... and even though it's still five hours 'til the opening bell, the energy here is fever-pitched.

Speaker: tishkoff
Dialogue: Where are they? That's what I want to know. Where are they?

Speaker: tishkoff
Dialogue: 'They'll be here.' Thanks a lot, Fidel.

Speaker: rusty
Dialogue: You boys have a nice trip?

Speaker: livingston
Dialogue: You've been red-flagged. It means the moment you step on the casino floor, they'll be watching you. Like hawks. Hawks with video cameras.

Speaker: rusty
Dialogue: You have any idea how this happened?

Speaker: linus
Dialogue: I do. He's been chasing Benedict's woman. Got into a real snarl with him two nights ago.  I was tailing you.

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: Who told you to do that?

Speaker: rusty
Dialogue: I did.  I knew you couldn't leave Tess alone.

Speaker: rusty
Dialogue: It's that or we shut down right now. His involvement puts us all at risk.

Speaker: rusty
Dialogue: You made it my call. When you put her ahead of us. You made it mine.

Dialogue: But, but... he can't just be out. Who's gonna take his place?

Speaker: rusty
Dialogue: Find everyone else. Let 'em know the change in plan. Curtain goes up at seven.

Dialogue: Tess is with Benedict now?  She's too tall for him.

Dialogue: Then inform Mr. Levin he'll find a better view of the fight in front of his television. Surely he must have H.B.O.

Dialogue: Put a guy on him. He's here for a reason. I'd like to know what it is. But if he comes anywhere near Tess, take it to the next level.

Dialogue: Mr. Zerga. It's a very busy night for me. Are we on schedule?

Dialogue: I have no reason to suspect otherwise. My couriers should be here momentarily.

Speaker: benedict
Dialogue: It's a nice evening. Shall we wait outside?

Speaker: turk
Dialogue: Mr. Zerga.   A gift from Mr. Hesse.

Dialogue: Lookin' like a bad night for the house.

Dialogue: Find Mr. Walsh. Tell him Mr. Ocean's in the west slots.

Dialogue: I'm afraid I can't allow my private security personnel inside the casino cages. I hope you don't mind...

Dialogue: Saul?   Saul Bloom, is that you?

Dialogue: Saul, it's me. Bucky Buchanan, remember? From Saratoga.

Speaker: saul
Dialogue: Mr. Benedict...  Please: I have never enjoyed the touch of steel to my skin.

Speaker: rusty
Dialogue: Where you gonna put your hands?

Speaker: rusty
Dialogue: Not the pockets, either. And don't touch your tie. Look at me...

Speaker: rusty
Dialogue: Wrong again. I ask you a question, you have to think of the answer, where you gonna look?

Speaker: rusty
Dialogue: Death. You look down, they know you're lying --

Speaker: rusty
Dialogue: -- and up they know you don't know the truth. Don't use three words when one will do, don't shift your eyes, look always at your mark but don't stare, be specific but not memorable, funny but don't make him laugh, he's gotta like you then forget you the moment you've left his sight, and for God's sakes whatever you do, don't under any circumstances --

Speaker: benedict
Dialogue: Can you lift them out, please?

Speaker: benedict
Dialogue: Alright, Mr. Zerga. I acknowledge that the case does not contain any dangerous or illicit material. I further agree to take custody of your case for a twenty-four hour period to store in our secured vault. While I cannot permit you to accompany the case to the vault...

Speaker: benedict
Dialogue: Insurance, for one. Security, another. And I don't trust you.

Speaker: benedict
Dialogue: Mr. Zerga, this is Mr. Walsh, my casino manager. If you will allow, he will arrange for your briefcase to be stored inside our vault while you watch on a security monitor.  Those are my terms. Yes or no?

Speaker: walsh
Dialogue: This is our security center, where we oversee all gaming in the casino as well as our vault. You'll be able to monitor your briefcase from here.

Dialogue: Sheldon Wills. Nevada Gaming Commission. Could I have two minutes of your time?

Speaker: benedict
Dialogue: Of course.   Anything for the N.G.C.

Speaker: rusty
Dialogue: Okay: when do you make the deposit?

Speaker: turk
Dialogue: Not until we get your signal.

Dialogue: Hey. What do we look like: a couple of peckerwood jackasses or something?

Speaker: rusty
Dialogue: Okay. I'm counting down.    Thirty minutes of breathing time starts... now.

Speaker: benedict
Dialogue: If he is who you say he is.

Dialogue: His head blocked the last two numbers.  We missed it, Linus. You gotta grab the combination yourself.

Dialogue: I know Hal Lindley over there. You work with him at all?

Dialogue: Not since he died last year.

Dialogue: Mr. Escalante. Would you come with us, please?

Speaker: benedict
Dialogue: I think it's better if we talked off the floor.

Dialogue: Good evening, Marcel. My nieces and I would like a table. Something quiet before the fight.

Speaker: tishkoff
Dialogue: Quick as you can.  The meter's running here.

Dialogue: Try to keep your tongue in your mouth.

Dialogue: Yeah, pal, well only if you take your thumb out of your...

Dialogue: Hey: you have any idea who I think I am?

Dialogue: I'm having you thrown out of here.

Speaker: tess
Dialogue: You're up to something, Danny. What? And don't say you came here for me. You're pulling a job, aren't you?

Speaker: tess
Dialogue: Well, know this: no matter what it is, you won't win me back. I can't afford it.

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: I just came to say good-bye.

Dialogue: Thank you for your cooperation, Mr. Escalante.  Or should I call you Mr. Catton?

Dialogue: You are Frank Catton? Formerly of the Tropicana, the Desert Inn and the New York State penitentiary system?

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: You heard me. Just 'cause a black man tries to earn a decent wage in this state...

Speaker: linus
Dialogue: That has nothing to do with...

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: ... some cracker cowboy like you's gotta kick him out on the street. Want me to jump down, turn around, pick a bale of cotton, won't let me deal cards, might as well call it whitejack.

Dialogue: Aw, I think... Jesus.    I lost my card.

Dialogue: I think... Jesus! I lost my keycard.

Dialogue: Please show this man off the premises.  Don't step foot in my casino again.

Dialogue: Mr. Wills, if you don't mind...  Mr. Wills?

Speaker: linus
Dialogue: My beeper.   I'm sorry.   I forgot it.

Speaker: benedict
Dialogue: You know how to get back out?

Dialogue: How much longer do you think Mr. Benedict will be?

Dialogue: No cameras in this room, huh? Don't want anyone seeing what happens here?

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: I guess Mr. Benedict didn't like me talking to his girl.

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: Then we better get to work.

Speaker: walsh
Dialogue: Does that satisfy you, Mr. Zerga?

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: You didn't really think I was gonna sit this one out, did you?

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: Crawlspace. And I had to give away a couple mil.

Dialogue: But what about -- I mean, that whole thing with Rusty...

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: You think the kid bought it?

Speaker: rusty
Dialogue: Hell, I think Reuben bought it, and he knew we were screwing around.  You sure about this?

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: Bobby Caldwell threw me into the pool first time. Least I could do is give his kid a push.

Speaker: linus
Dialogue: Why'd you make me go through all this? Why not just tell me?

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: Well, where's the fun in that?  C'mon: Yen's got about three minutes of air left.

Dialogue: You're too late, guys.   He's dead.

Dialogue: The fight...?  How strongly do you feel about it?

Dialogue: I'd go in for a buck.

Dialogue: The fountain goes flaccid.  BASHER  ... two, three...

Dialogue: No, but you're sweet to ask.

Dialogue: One second.  I thought you got kicked out?

Dialogue: This tape's from last night.   Same guards, same...

Speaker: linus
Dialogue: You think Yen made it out okay?

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: There's a Chinese man with a hundred sixty million dollars behind that door. Let's get him out.

Dialogue: There's still the five pins and the floor sensor. Not much we can do about that from this side of the door. But from this side...

Dialogue: ... a little bit of Semtex should do the trick.

Speaker: livingston
Dialogue: Linus, can you read me? Linus, do not blow the door, you're about to kill Yen.

Speaker: linus
Dialogue: You know, you lose focus for one second in this game --

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: -- and someone gets hurt, yeah yeah. I don't hear Yen complaining.

Dialogue: No, I guess not. Not really.

Dialogue: I don't have a cell phone.

Speaker: benedict
Dialogue: See who's on the other end.

Dialogue: What the hell is going on down there in the vault?

Speaker: benedict
Dialogue: Find out how much money we have down there.

Speaker: benedict
Dialogue: Alright. You've proved your point. You've broken into my vault. Congratulations: you're a dead man.

Speaker: benedict
Dialogue: May I ask: how do you expect to leave here, hmm?

Speaker: benedict
Dialogue: Do you believe I'll simply allow you to parade bags full of my money out my casino doors?

Speaker: rusty
Dialogue: No.   You're gonna carry it out for us.

Speaker: benedict
Dialogue: And why would I do that?

Speaker: rusty
Dialogue: Take a closer look at your monitor...

Speaker: rusty
Dialogue: You let our eighty million go, and you get to keep your eighty. That's the deal. You try and stop us, we'll blow both cash loads.

Speaker: rusty
Dialogue: Mr. Benedict: you can lose eighty million dollars secretly tonight or you can lose a hundred sixty million dollars publicly. It's your decision.

Speaker: rusty
Dialogue: He's fine. He wants you to go upstairs, and watch TV.

Speaker: rusty
Dialogue: It's alright, Tess. I promise.  Good. Here's what you do. Five minutes from now, the men in the vault are going to deposit six bags in the vault elevator.

Dialogue: If they take more than twenty seconds to reach the casino floor or if there's any indication a switch has been made, we'll blow the money in the vault and the money in the bags.

Dialogue: He's in the casino right now.

Dialogue: Sir, I have complied with your every request, would you agree?

Speaker: benedict
Dialogue: Good.   Now I have one of my own.

Speaker: benedict
Dialogue: Run and hide. That's all I ask.

Dialogue: Our guys say the van is headed toward McCarren Airport.

Speaker: benedict
Dialogue: Get everyone in position. I want my vault back before that van hits the tarmac.

Dialogue: Find out how they fiddled with our cameras.

Dialogue: Get out of the van, now!   Now!

Dialogue: We couldn't find any survivors. Or, I'm afraid, any of your money. I'm sorry, sir.

Dialogue: Okay, guys, grab your gear and clear out.

Dialogue: Walsh: How are we with the van?

Dialogue: Out of the van now! Hands up!

Dialogue: What do you mean there was no money in the bags?

Dialogue: Walsh, cue up the tape of the robbery.

Dialogue: No, sir. It doesn't. I -- I don't understand...

Speaker: benedict
Dialogue: We had that installed on Tuesday. The image we saw of the men robbing us was a tape.

Speaker: benedict
Dialogue: Someone built a double of my vault, then made a tape of them robbing it. When we saw them putting money in those bags, that wasn't actually happening.

Dialogue: Las Vegas P.D. This is Officer Brooks, New Jersey Probation Division. I have a violator in your jurisdiction...  Hit it.

Dialogue: Heya, Benedict... How's the other fight going?

Dialogue: Did you have a hand in this?  Did you?

Dialogue: You get robbed or something, Benedict? Geez, that's a shame.

Dialogue: What would you say if I told you you could get your money back...  What would you say?

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: Well, that's very interesting...  ... but I didn't have anything to do with it.

Dialogue: Escort Mr. Ocean to the exit. And contact the police. I would imagine Mr. Ocean is in violation of his parole.

Dialogue: Maybe we should have held him.

Dialogue: You of all people should know, Terry: in your hotel, there's always someone watching.

Dialogue: I knew what I was doing.

Dialogue: Three to six months, I should think.

Dialogue: Thirteen million and you drive that piece of shit cross country to pick me up?

Dialogue: Your eyes got closer together.  How's life?

Dialogue: Life... is a roomful of pillows.  C'mon...

Dialogue: Where do you want to go first?
